awd_titl_txt: Florida A&M GEOSCIENCE Education: Improving Undergraduate GEOSCIENCE Teacher        Preparation using the Multiplication Factor of Micro Spiral Methodology Workshop
awd_abstract_narration:
This project will provide pre-service and in-service educators with strategies toward training their undergraduate and graduate students on usage of the multiplication factors of Micro-Spiral Methodology (MSM) to improve K-12 understanding of Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM) concepts. The workshop will provide participants with the protocol of the MSM effective teaching method for grades K-12 to increase knowledge of future educators and students in the STEM areas with emphasis in geosciences. The workshop will use the Spiral Curriculum that has been used for decades in the transfer of concepts, knowledge and skills. Training in this methodology could be beneficial at multiple levels of an educational system that is currently in transition due to a global pandemic.

The overarching goal of the Geoscience MSM is to increase Geoscience content knowledge and create Critical-thinkers as well as lifelong learners. Specific goals include teaching educational stakeholders like university faculty at HBCUs, teachers (in-service and pre-service), as well as administrators about the protocol of the MSM and the benefit of the Multiplication Factor of the MSM. Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCU) Geoscience Micro-Spiral programs can deliver a multidimensional strategic solution to professional development for teachers and educational coordinators to improve access to the geosciences. Specific workshop objectives include: 1) increasing the knowledge and understanding of the geosciences so concepts can transfer to future students, 2) supporting pre-service teacher education programs by enriching their knowledge and understanding of geoscience content and 3) supporting in-service teachers by increasing their knowledge in the geosciences so that they can assist in the training of future geoscience professionals.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_div_long_name: Integrative and Collaborative Education and Research (ICER)

por.por_cntn:
The COVID 19 Pandemic has impacted our educational institutions on every level. Educational Institutions are reporting to be behind academically as much as one year or more in the transfer of concepts, knowledge, and skills to their students. The impact of the Delta variant of COVID virus on the already weakened educational system is an unknown. What we do know is that scientific evidence shows Micro-Spiral Method (MSM) is effective in overcoming absenteeism and loss of instructional time which has helped raise the state science test scores for well over a decade at a Developmental Research School in Tallahassee, Florida. The Micro-Spiral Methodology is the recursive repetition of concepts, knowledge, and skills, causing a deeper understanding of concepts, knowledge, and skills with each successive encounter building on the previous encounters (Davis, 2015). The seminal work which took an entire year of a science education curriculum compressed it into three months, delivered the concepts, knowledge and skills to the students and the results were phenomenal. African Americans state science scores went up by 45 %, Latina Americans state science scores went up close to 30 %, Anglo Americans state science scores went up close to 30 %, Economically Disadvantaged science scores went up to 32 %. As a matter of fact, males, females, gifted and promising, above average, average, as well as special needs students state science test scores went up (CASPER, 2007). The longitudinal study shows that for over the past decade that those who used the MSM program state science test scores continue to go up. The students scored especially high in the geosciences (Florida Department of Education (DOE), Statewide Science Assessment 2009-2020).

The broader impacts on society includes teaching university faculty at HBCUs about learning progressions who are then able to produce knowledgeable, literate, and critical thinking for pre-service and K-16 teachers who understand learning progressions through the process of a Micro-Spiral and integrating cutting-edge earth science concepts into their courses. Expanding HBCU programs for Geosciences Education will deliver a strategic multidimensional solution to impact K-16 teacher and professors in the preparation of curricula as well as professional development activities. And improve minority access to geosciences. The MSM MF strengthen the geosciences content knowledge as well as demonstrate the impact of the Multiplication Factor for all who adopts this methodology. Which in turn will strengthen the concepts, knowledge, and skills of the students that they teach. The overarching goals of the Geosciences MSM is to increase Geosciences content knowledge, increase the number of minorities in the Geosciences and create critical thinkers as well as lifelong learners.

The Micro Spiral Method Multiplication Factor (MSM MF) workshop provided the micro-spiral approach of teaching which helps overcome absenteeism and loss of instructional time as well as harnessing the multiplication factor to increase the impact of the benefits of the MSM MF.The Micro-Spiral Method Multiplication Factor can improve teachers and especially geoscience teachers ability to provide transgenerational, transcultural, and transformational solutions to our world.

Provided training in the communication knowledge of geosciences both culturally and regionally.

Provided support to Pre-Service teacher education programs in the teaching geosciences concepts, knowledge, and skills through the Micro-Spiral Method.

Provided support In-Service teachers in their quest to educate future Geoscientists.

Provided support the Educational Stakeholders in their mission to educate future Geoscientists.

https://wfsu.org/radio/voices-that-inspire/edith-davis/ Featured on National Public Radio (NPR) Inspired Program.

Reginald Archer, Edith Davis, and Sue Ebanks Geological Society of America (GSA) Chapter Book Title:  GEOPATHS Broadening the Voices in Geosciences: Pathways to Innovation Pedagogy and Professional Development.

Davis, Edith "The Multiplication Factor of the Micro Spiral Methodology and achieving lasting learning outcomes." The International Journal of Science in Society (2023): TBD, 2023.

2023_ATE Jacksonville #2-2 copy 2.pdf

2023 ATE Annual Meetings in Jacksonville, Florida March 25-29, 2023, Presenter, Chairwoman Science Education, Chair of Science Education Roundtable. The Theme was the Micro-Spiral Method Multiplication Factor.

2023 ATE Annual Meetings in Jacksonville, Florida March 25-29, 2023, Micro-Spiral Method Multiplication Factor (In-Service, Pre-Service Teacher and Higher Education Professor).

2023 ATE Annual Meetings in Jacksonville, Florida March 27, 2023, Micro-Spiral Method Multiplication Factor Roundtable Discussion (Association of Teacher Educators 2023 103rd).

2023 ATE Annual Meetings in Jacksonville, Florida March 27, 2023, Special Interest Group (Association of Teacher Educators 2023 103rd). Presented Micro-Spiral Method Multiplication Factor.

2023 ATE Annual Meetings on March 27, 2023, Micro-Spiral Presentation (Association of Teacher Educators 2023 103rd Anniversary).

2022 ATE Annual Meetings in Chicago, Illinois February 11-16, 2022, Presenter, Chairwoman Science Education, Chair of Science Education Roundtable. The Theme was the Micro-Spiral Method Multiplication Factor.
